data.title: Custom keyboard layout messes up keyboard shortcuts
data.body:
I am using the [Colemak layout](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/84/KB_US-Colemak.svg/1200px-KB_US-Colemak.svg.png). A fair number of keys are not where they usually are.
For example: The `S` key is where the `D` key usually is. The `O` key is right next to where `L` usually is...

So, in Cryengine, when I want to save something (`CTRL+S`), I cannot simply press on the key below `W`. I have to press on where the `D` key usually is. 

On Windows, this is nonstandard behavior: The vast majority of programs know that as soon as I press on `CTRL`, my layout is the standard layout. (Because that is how my keyboard is configured.) So, `CTRL+S` is where it is "supposed" to be. 


This issue affects every user with a different keyboard layout:
- Everybody in Germany/Austria (QWERTZ) (`CTRL+Z` and `CTRL+Y` are swapped.)
- All the French people (AZERTY)
- All the Dvorak users
- etc.
However, it does not affect people with a non-ASCII keyboard layout such as the Japanese.

data.title: Collision data corrupt when export to engine used with CryPhysx
data.body:
When CryPhysx selected as engine physics library, export to engine from sandbox corrupts static collision data (at least convex verified to be missing). After export to engine and game started with GameLauncher, all static collisions seem to have vanished and dynamic objects fall through. Physics simulation still works properly in sandbox.

In such case, PhysX Visual Debugger doesn't show the static collision objects anymore when using GameLauncher (they show up with sandbox).

Repro steps:

1. Set CryPhysX as physics library
2. Open RollingBall cpp template in sandbox
3. Use "Export to engine" from sandbox
4. Launch RollingBall game with GameLauncher

Tested with 5.4.0 final with PhysX 3.3.4 and PhysX 3.4.1

data.title: CryPhysX doesn't have terrain collision with GameLauncher
data.body:
When opened in sandbox, terrain (heightfield) collision works, if launched in standalone, it doesn't.

CGeomManager::CreatePrimitive creates the heightfield twice when launched with GameLauncher but all the heightfield cells have 0 height.

If opened in sandbox, CGeomManager::CreatePrimitive creates those same two 0 height heightfields but also five heightfields that have the right data (same correct data on all of those).

According to PhysX Visual Debugger, PhysX scene itself has one heightfield when opened in both sandbox and GameLauncher.

Tested with 5.4.0 final with PhysX 3.3.4 and PhysX 3.4.1

data.title: Access violation when calling Ragdollize() on a CharacterControllerComponent
data.body: According to Alexander Klinger: "It will always crash since it doesn't know the right character slot. There is a bug in the ResetCharacter function of the CAdvancedAnimationComponent."

worse is Linux doesn't have Vulkan support currently so also CryRenderVulkan.so is missing so making Linux release in fact not usable as no graphcis backend..

data.title: Custom Schematyc entity c++ Corrupts level layer
Boolean destruction (breakable trees) crashing in game templates
data.body: As the title says, I have everything setup perfectly but the boolean destruction crashes the engine. I register the explosion shape on ESYSTEM_EVENT_LEVEL_LOAD_START event the same way it is done in GameSDK. I setup the SurfaceTypes.xml and materialeffects the same way as GameSDK. I use the palm tree asset to test this and upon colliding a heavy mesh with the tree, I can see the tree break using "p_draw_helpers 2" but it crashes a second after that. The crash happens in UpdateDeformableStatObj of Cry3DEngine at line 836. Now this all works fine in GameSDK. I have no idea what could be causing the crash in the game templates since I setup everything the exact same way as the GameSDK project.

data.title: Mesh blending does not work with self-shadowing from POM
data.body: Soft Depth Test disables Self Shadow Strenght. These two technologies do not work together, if you want mesh blending, there will not be any shadows from POM, and vice versa. Let's preview 8 with fixing this bug

data.title: 5.4p7 Schematyc Mesh Component Scale
data.body: Mesh component scale property does not persist between save and load.

data.title: Projector Light Component's Transformation properties not being applied
data.body: Projector Light Component's translation and rotation properties don't have any effect on the component. I want to make a simple flashlight and I have created a Mesh component with a flashlight model assigned. I then added the Projector Light Component to it but the light is pointing in the wrong direction and not in the correct position. I try to use the translation and rotation properties of the Projector Light Component to correct this but they don't do anything.

data.title: 5.4p7 Schematyc Rigidbody Component
data.body: Seems to have no effect on mesh. Following the schematyc pickups guide, in 5.4.0p7. Applying constant impulse on update or start also has no effect.

data.title: Displacement mapping broken in 5.4
data.body:
Displacement mapping broken in 5.4 Sandbox and GameLauncher (so with DX11 at least). Used to work on 5.3.

Repro:
1. Make a new material
2. Add Diffuse, Normal and Heightmaps into material slots
3. Enable Displacement Mapping from Shader Generation Params
4. Make sure tessellation is on (e_tessellation=1 or sys_spec = 4)

data.body:
This crash occurs occasionally when using ground alignment IK.
`m_pIkLimbType` is null sometimes during `Execute` - I'm assuming `Initialize` is being called during `Execute`

data.title: Adjusting e_ShadowsMaxTexRes value to 2048 results in Sandbox Crash!
data.body:
Title : Adjusting e_ShadowsMaxTexRes value to 2048 results in Sandbox Crash - Sandbox Editor
Platform : Windows 10 Home 64 Bit
Build : 143 as shipped.
Version Number : 5.4.0

Adjusting e_ShadowsMaxTexRes console variable to 2048 results in crash, default value of 1024 works fine, 1536 helps a bit on shadows, but 2048 does not work and crashes the Sandbox Editor.

Steps to reproduce :

1. Open up Sandbox Editor.
2. Open up a level.
3. Open up Console Variables.
4. Type in e_ShadowsMaxTexRes and adjust value to 2048.
5. Crash.

data.title: Removing UIActions causes a crash in Sandbox.
data.body:
Title : Removing UIActions causes a crash in Sandbox - Flowgraph Editor
Platform : Windows 10 Home 64 Bit
Build : 143 as shipped.
Version Number : 5.4.0

When trying to create a custom UIAction the Sandbox Editor crashes when deleting the UIAction name. Deleting the file manually under libs\uiaction works fine then restarting the Editor. The issue is gone. It's just deleting the entry via Sandbox Editor that has issues.

Steps to reproduce :
1. Open up Sandbox Editor.
2. Open up a level.
3. Open up Flowgraph Editor.
4. Create custom UIAction with a name, slick save.
5. Populate UIAction with UI:Action:Start, additional FG nodes and UI:Action:End.
6. Call the UIAction with UI:Action:Control.
7. Rightclick custom UIAction name and click Delete.
8. Crash.

data.title: Too many heap sections crash
data.body:
Hi! When run CryEngine editor it displays the error: 

> Fatal error in gc (Too many heap sections)

 and then CryEngine crash.

**OS:** Windows 10.0.15063.540
